name: Easy Let Minnow When You Get There Trivia Quiz | Our World for Kids | 10 Questions

questions.text: If I were a salmon and lived in the biggest body of water on our planet, where would I live?
questions.explanation:
Pacific Ocean.

	The Pacific Ocean is by far the largest body of water on our planet. It is larger than all of the land on earth combined. The name comes from the Latin word 'pacificus' which means peaceful and calm.

questions.text: If you were wanting to catch a brown trout and were in London, England, in which of the rivers could you fish?
questions.explanation:
The Thames River.

	The Thames River or River Thames is the longest river that lies entirely in England and it flows through central London, Oxford, Windsor and Richmond. Ducks, swans and geese can be seen up and down the river. There are many types of fish in the River Thames, including brown trout, pike, flounder, dace, and eel.

questions.text: If I were a lake sturgeon and wanted to make my home in the largest lake in North America, which one of these bodies of water would I choose?
questions.explanation:
Lake Superior.

	I would choose Lake Superior, the largest freshwater lake in the whole world. There are over sixty different types of fish who call this massive lake home, including the sturgeon, lake trout, and rock bass. Lake Superior lies between the American states of Minnesota, Wisconsin and Michigan, and by the Canadian province of Ontario.

questions.text: If I were an anchovy and wanted to live in a beautiful sea surrounded by such countries as Italy, Egypt, Greece, Spain and Morocco, to which of these bodies of water should I move?
questions.explanation:
Mediterranean Sea.

	The beautiful Mediterranean sea lies surrounded by the continents of Africa Asia and Europe. With openings to the Atlantic Ocean and multiple large rivers draining into it, the Mediterranean Sea has many types of aquatic life. Sharks, eels, anchovies, pipefish and stingray all make their homes in this hospitable body of water.

questions.text: If I were a South American piranha, which of these rivers might I live in?
questions.explanation:
Amazon River.

	The Amazon River is one of the largest rivers in the world and home to a huge variety of aquatic life found nowhere else in the world. Located in the northern area of South America, this river is home to the fearsome piranha who plays an important part in the life cycle of this body of water by carrying out its role as both predator and scavenger.

questions.text: In which of the colorfully named bodies of water would you find Nemo the clownfish and the Great Barrier Reef?
questions.explanation:
The Coral Sea.

	Located on the northeast coast of Queensland, Australia, the Coral Sea is home to the unique Great Barrier Reef. The Coral Sea is known for its warm climate and frequent cyclone activity. It is home to many warm water animals including the clown fish, dolphins, and turtles and fishing near this area is strictly forbidden.

questions.text: In which of these bodies of water would you most likely see a beluga whale or a polar bear swimming?
questions.explanation:
Arctic Ocean.

	The Arctic Ocean covers most of the Northern Arctic regions and large parts of it freeze over every winter. It is the least salty of all the oceans and is home to many unusual species that thrive in cold water. These include the Greenland shark, the narwhal, the beluga whale and polar bear who live all around the oceans and feed primarily on sea life from the Arctic Ocean.

questions.text: There are many kinds of fish that live in the body of water known as the Dead Sea.
questions.explanation:
False.

	The Dead Sea is a large salt lake that borders the countries of Jordan and Israel. It derives its name from the fact that it is so salty that there are no fish living in it. The only form of life that lives in it is a form of bacteria that is too small to be seen with the naked eye.

questions.text: If I were a fish, which of these bodies of water would I avoid so that crocodiles did not eat me for dinner?
questions.explanation:
The Nile River.

	The only one of these bodies of water that has crocodiles is the Nile River in northern Africa. The Nile is considered to be one of the longest rivers in the world and is notable because it flows north instead of south. It is also home to some of the largest crocodiles in the world.

questions.text: If I were a catfish swimming the length of the Mississippi River, which one of these bodies of water could I end up in?
questions.explanation:
The Gulf of Mexico.

	The Mississippi flows into the Gulf of Mexico and travels the length of the United States down the approximate middle of the continent. This large river is home to many types of fish and other aquatic life. It is one of the main transportation rivers in North America.
